meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: It's Official: The Era Of The Personal Computer Is Over

div.div: As a signpost on the road to the so-called Post-PC Era we’ve been hearing about for so many years, this one is pretty hard to argue with: As of this year, personal computers no longer consume the majority of the world’s memory chip supply.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qs9eij&via=Digg&text=It's Official: The Era Of The Personal Computer Is Over

div.div: Apple says their new earpods took 3 years to develop. That's cool, but Apple also claims they sound better than earphones that cost "hundreds of dollars."

div.a: How Your Brain Lies To You About Art

div.div: Why is that our brains "lie" and make us see things in art that aren't really there?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OONWus&via=Digg&text=How Your Brain Lies To You About Art

div.a: The Stories Of 10 People Who Died On Mt. Everest In 2012

div.div: In the 16 years since Into Thin Air, Mount Everest has become safer in many ways, with better storm forecasting and amazing high-altitude rescue helicopters. So why did 10 people die in 2012?

li.div: Revenge effects in weather: Better weather forecasts have made Everest riskier. outsideonline.com/outdoor-... /cc @edward_tenner

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OsywQM&via=Digg&text=The Stories Of 10 People Who Died On Mt. Everest In 2012

div.a: Why Bike Theft Is So Hard To Stop

div.div: The F.B.I. values stolen bicycles and their parts at $350 million a year. That's a lot of handlebar bells.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QLokkX&via=Digg&text=Why Bike Theft Is So Hard To Stop

div.a: Where Google Thinks You Spent Your Summer

div.div: Google looked at Google Maps search activity to figure out where we all spent our summer.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PxSAQE&via=Digg&text=Where Google Thinks You Spent Your Summer

div.a: What's The Most Earthquake-Prone State In The U.S.?

div.div: A recently created World Earthquake Intensity Map shows where people around the globe are most at risk from dangerous seismic activity.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U7LVxA&via=Digg&text=What's The Most Earthquake-Prone State In The U.S.?

div.a: Verbs: How Apple And Nintendo Get You To Buy Their Products

div.div: While most of their competitors are in the business of loudly selling content and (some) innovation, Apple and Nintendo are in the business of selling verbs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RarD1S&via=Digg&text=Verbs: How Apple And Nintendo Get You To Buy Their Products

div.a: Man Boobs Solve The Mystery Of King Tut's Death?

div.div: The mystery of King Tut’s death might finally be solved, according to one scientist who argues that the secret to the young Pharaohs demise is hidden in plain sight.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SMqPXA&via=Digg&text=Man Boobs Solve The Mystery Of King Tut's Death?

div.a: A Literal Epidemic Of Crutch Words

div.div: It appears we're living in a crutch word epidemic. There are so many!

div.a: GoPro Camera Captures Free-Fall From 12.5K Feet When Skydiver Drops It

div.div: "Bumped my head on the door frame on exit unclasping the latch on the box. The camera popped out on exit at 12.500 and fell straight down onto the landing area at the DZ and was recovered by a fellow skydiver."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R1B7ln&via=Digg&text=GoPro Camera Captures Free-Fall From 12.5K Feet When Skydiver Drops It

div.a: Booze Comes To Disney World's Magic Kingdom

div.div: For the first time since Walt Disney World's Magic Kingdom opened four decades ago, thirsty tourists will soon be able to order a glass of wine or beer within park boundaries.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QguNVn&via=Digg&text=Booze Comes To Disney World's Magic Kingdom

div.a: Hollywood Finds Digitization Isn't So Scary After All

div.div: With Netflix, Amazon, and soon Verizon Communications and Redbox bidding for rights to stream movies on Kindles, iPads, and TVs, the studios are enjoying a boomlet that’s taking the edge off declining disc sales and rentals.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q6MmEn&via=Digg&text=Hollywood Finds Digitization Isn't So Scary After All

div.a: First Cast Pics From Hunger Games Sequel

div.div: Filming is underway on The Hunger Games: Catching Fire, so the inevitable set photos have begun to leak out.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SkxWA4&via=Digg&text=First Cast Pics From Hunger Games Sequel

div.a: U.S. Scrambles To Rush Spies, Drones To Libya

div.div: The U.S. is sending more spies, Marines and drones to Libya, trying to speed the search for those who killed the U.S. ambassador and three other Americans.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RTsbbW&via=Digg&text=U.S. Scrambles To Rush Spies, Drones To Libya

div.a: How One Musician Raised Over A $1 Million On Kickstarter And Didn't Pay Her Band A Dime

div.div: The American Federation of Musicians of the U.S. And Canada have started a petition in the hopes of getting Dresden Doll and singer extraordinaire, Amanda Palmer, to pay her musicians.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qc9qld&via=Digg&text=How One Musician Raised Over A $1 Million On Kickstarter And Didn't Pay Her Band A Dime

div.a: How Big Is A Petabyte, Exabyte, Zettabyte, Or A Yottabyte?

div.a: How Executives Hide Their Email Addresses

div.div: Executives — especially VPs with the word “customer service” in their title — don’t really want to hear from you when you have a problem. Here's how you can reach them anyway.
